creator: andreas.hitzbleck@softwareag.com
text:
We wrote a new Realm for Tomcat which connects to our database and 
authenticates users with username/password. Everything works fine dispite that 
there are problems with the log-off mechanism.

If you log in as administrator, log off (done by session.invalidate()) and log 
in again with an other username, it happens some times that you will be logged 
in as administrator again (even from other computers!). 

Switching to another servlet engine fixes the problem. Is it possible that 
Tomcat does not disable the session correctly?

I think this was Fixed in Tomcat 3.3 and in Tomcat 3.2.2..

Can you check against one of them?
